question: Which country's nuclear program agreement is known as the "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action"?
explanation: Iran's nuclear program agreement is known as the "Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action". The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, known commonly as the Iran nuclear deal or Iran deal, is an agreement on the Iranian nuclear program reached in Vienna on 14 July 2015, between Iran and the P5+1 (the five permanent members of the United Nations Security Council—China, France, Russia, United Kingdom, United States—plus Germany) together with the European Union.
